newsitem.title: USA: Foilmark sees Q4 net loss vs profit.
newsitem.headline: Foilmark sees Q4 net loss vs profit.

text.p: Foilmark Inc said on Tuesday it expects to report a net loss of $860,000, or $0.21 per share, for the fourth quarter of 1996.
That compares to a profit of $244,717, or 0.06 per share, for the same period the year before.
Foilmark also said it expects to report a net loss of $830,000, or $0.20 per share, for full-year 1996, compared to a profit of $1.84 million, or $0.46 per share, in 1995.

Foilmark said it was releasing the estimated results because it has filed a notification of late filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for its Form 10-K, due to ongoing settlement negotiations from a personal-injury lawsuit filed against the company.
The company said its 1996 results were hurt by softness in the market for hot stamping foils and machines, a 25-percent increase in the cost of polyester film and other factors.
Foilmark makes equipment and products used to apply metallic pigmented holographic foils and ink decorations to a wide variety of materials.
